name: Trivial Television Quiz | TV Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the family featured in "Father Knows Best"?
questions.explanation:
Anderson.

	Robert Young originated the role of Jim Anderson on radio in 1949.  He reprised his role in the TV series which ran from 1954 to 1963.

questions.text: What does the initial "R" stand for in J.R. Ewing from the show "Dallas"?
questions.explanation:
Ross.

	Larry Hagman played J.R. Ewing on this hit prime-time soap opera which ran from 1978 to 1991.

questions.text: What was the name of the newspaper Oscar Madison wrote for on "The Odd Couple"?
questions.explanation:
The New York Herald.

	Jack Klugman played Oscar Madison along with Tony Randall who played Felix Unger on "The Odd Couple".  The show was adapted from the Neil Simon play (1965) which was turned into a movie (1968) and then the TV show which ran from 1970-1975.

questions.text: What was Richie Petrie's middle name on "The Dick Van Dyke Show"?
questions.explanation:
Rosebud.

	Rosebud was an acronym for Robert, Oscar, Samuel, Edward, Benjamin, Ulysses, and David.  The show which starred Dick Van Dyke and Mary Tyler Moore, ran from 1961-1966.

questions.text: Finish the lyrics to the "Laverne and Shirley" theme song.  "Never heard the word..."
questions.explanation:
Impossible.

	"Laverne and Shirley" starred Penny Marshall and Cindy Williams.  It was a spin off of "Happy Days" and aired from 1976-1983.

questions.text: Howard Cunningham owned an auto repair shop on "Happy Days".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Tom Bosley played Howard Cunningham who worked at and then later owned a hardware store. The show ran from 1974-1984.

questions.text: In what city did "Car 54, Where Are You?" take place?
questions.explanation:
New York.

	"Car 54, Where Are You?" aired for only two seasons (1961-1963) and starred Fred Gwynne, who would later be known to TV viewers as Herman Munster on "The Munsters".

questions.text: Who was Mr. Woodman's replacement as vice-principal at Buchanan High on "Welcome Back Kotter"?
questions.explanation:
Gabe Kotter.

	"Welcome Back Kotter" aired from 1975-1979 and starred Gabe Kaplan as Mr. Kotter and John Travolta as Vinnie Barbarino.

questions.text: What was the name of the restaurant on "Alice"?
questions.explanation:
Mel's Diner.

	Linda Lavin played the title role in "Alice" where she portrayed a single mother working as a waitress.  Adapted from the movie "Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore."  Vic Tayback played Mel in the movie as well as the TV show which aired from 1976-1985.

questions.text: In what state did the show "The Andy Griffith Show" take place?
questions.explanation:
North Carolina.

	The show was a spin off from "The Danny Thomas Show" and ran from 1960-1968.  It continued it's run as "Mayberry,R.F.D." from 1968-1971.  It starred Andy Griffith and Ron Howard who would later be known to TV viewers as Richie Cunningham on "Happy Days".
